src.hashers.hasher module

Abstract Hasher Class giving the definition of how a Hasher behaves.

class src.hashers.hasher.Hasher

Bases: ABC

Abstract Hasher Class giving the definition of how a Hasher behaves.

abstract hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash

Calculates the hash by a concrete method for each byte and adding it to an N-bit hash.

Args:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

src.hashers.division_method_hasher module

Adds the remainder of a modulus to a 64 bit hash, for each byte in the input.

class src.hashers.division_method_hasher.DivisionMethodHasher

Bases: Hasher

Concrete implementation of the Abstract Hasher class that takes the modulus of each byte k by M and adds the remainder to a 64 bit hash.

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash

Calculates the hash by taking the modulus of each byte and adding it to a 64-bit hash.

Args:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

src.hashers.multiplication_method_hasher module

Multiplication Hash which follows the formula h(K) = floor (M (kA mod 1)).

class src.hashers.multiplication_method_hasher.MultiplicationHasher

Bases: Hasher

  1. Choose a constant value A such that 0 < A < 1.

  2. Multiply the key value with A.

  3. Extract the fractional part of kA.

  4. Multiply the result of the above step by the size of the hash table i.e. M.

  5. The resulting hash value is obtained by taking the floor of the result obtained in step 4.

credits: https://cs.kenyon.edu/index.php/scmp-218-00-data-structures/types-of-hash-functions/

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash

Calculates the hash by a concrete method for each byte and adding it to an N-bit hash.

Args:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

src.hashers.mumurhash_32_method_hasher module

Murmurhash 32 implementation, a non-cryptographic hash function suitable for general hash-based lookup

class src.hashers.mumurhash_32_method_hasher.MurmurHash32MethodHasher

Bases: Hasher

Python implementation of the murmurhash 32 bit x86 algorithm

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash

Murmurhash algorithm implementation

rotl32(x, n)

Bitwise left rotating the value of x by n positions
